alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Fergus County below 4500ft; Hill County; Northern Blaine County; Snowy and Judith Mountains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 12:29AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong wind gusts ahead of a line of showers and thunderstorms will impact portions of Fergus, Blaine, Hill and northeastern Chouteau Counties through 200 AM MDT... At 1223 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and thunderstorms associated with a cold front along a line extending from western Hill County south through the Bears Paw and continuing south through western Fergus county. These showers and storms were morning east at 35 to 40 mph and are preceded by a shift to west winds with gusts reaching 40 to 50 mph. Showers and thunderstorms will follow the initial period of gusty west winds with occasional lightning and brief heavier rainfall. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Havre, Lewistown, Chinook, Big Sandy, Harlem, Winifred, Grass Range, Parker School, Beaver Creek, Hays, Azure, Agency, St. Pierre, Gildford, Sangrey, Boneau, Fort Belknap, Turner, Box Elder, and Roy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
